I want to use a radio as a bridge and I don’t want to buy a POE injector would a setup like this work or do i need to add a vrm or something.

Untitled772×629 123 KB

Technically you can just wire it to a 12v power brick and plug it into a wall outlet.

No VRM necessary. The Vivid Hosting radio is mean to run on unregulated 12V (from either POE or the seperate power input). Which means as long as its getting close to 12V (4.5V-19V is on the spec sheet) it will work fine.

Edit: In your setup the port you are trying to use is rated for 12V/2A. The radio draws 0.5A @ 12V, which means it should be fine, but you could also plug the radio into any of the large power ports and it would work.

If it’s the client radio on the robot, it can be supplied with unregulated battery voltage. See R616C and R617.

If your radio is configured as an AP, you can’t run it off of a battery.

This is both a legal requirement and a technical one. Yes, the radio detects it, and we aren’t allowed to know how (lest we figure out how to bypass it).

Why does a rookie team have a PDB that was phased out a decade ago?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T23:06:09.329Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":22.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482278,"topic_slug":"can-i-power-new-vivid-hosting-radio-with-blue-pdp","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/can-i-power-new-vivid-hosting-radio-with-blue-pdp/482278/7","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3486151,"name":"Sean","username":"Skimonster110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skimonster110/{size}/261842_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T23:18:34.794Z","cooked":"

We are a rookie team but the old stuff from our schools old team(S.C.R.A.P. 4151) that got shut down due to covid and the stuff was given to us. We didn’t have any members from the old team, we didn’t have the same teacher that ran the club, so we started with a new number. We kept S.C.R.A.P. as it was well know in our community. Recently we got mentor’s that were former ulumni and theve been helping us navigate FIRST.
